meanings.definition: The act of bringing land, industries, or other property under the control of a nation or government.
meanings.sent1: The nationalization of the railway system ensured it was managed by the government.
meanings.sent2: The nationalization of the oil industry led to increased government involvement in production.
meanings.sent3: After the nationalization of the parks, everyone had to follow the new rules for camping.
meanings.sent4: The nationalization of the internet would be like giving control of it to the entire country.
meanings.sent5: The nationalization of the schools made education more accessible to all citizens.

meanings.definition: The process of converting private ownership or control into public ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: Nationalization of the company meant that it was now owned by the government.
meanings.sent2: The nationalization of the water supply ensured fair access for all residents.
meanings.sent3: The nationalization of the bakery turned it into a community-run business.
meanings.sent4: The nationalization of the bookstore transformed it into a public library.
meanings.sent5: The nationalization of the farm allowed everyone in the town to benefit from its produce.
